cit:title.gco:CharacterString: IMOS - ACORN - Coral Coast HF ocean radar site (Western Australia, Australia)

cit:description.gco:CharacterString: Website of the Integrated Marine Observing System (IMOS)

cit:otherCitationDetails.gco:CharacterString: The citation in a list of references is: "IMOS [year-of-data-download], [Title], [data-access-URL], accessed [date-of-access].".

cit:description.gco:CharacterString: Website of the Integrated Marine Observing System (IMOS)

mri:abstract.gco:CharacterString:
The Coral Coast (CORL) HF ocean radar system covers an area of the Western Australia Coast, Western Australia, an area subject to the variability of the Leeuwin Current (LC) and its coupling with coastal winds, tides, and waves. In this area the LC generates several eddies which control the larval species and the higher marine species and ecosystems in which they forage.
The CORL HF ocean radar system consists of two SeaSonde crossed loop direction finding stations located at Dongara - Port Denison (29.283 S 114.920E) and Green Head (114.967 E 30.073 S). These radars operate at a frequency of 4.463 MHz, with a bandwidth of 25 KHz, a maximum range of 200 Km and a range resolution of 6 Km. Within the HF radar coverage area surface currents are measured.
The CORL area of coverage has a small overlap of commonly observed ocean with the Turqoise Coast (TURQ) SeaSonde HF ocean radar system on its southern side, which in turns early overlaps with the Rottnest HF radar node. Together, the CORL, TURQ and ROT systems provide continuous monitoring of the shelf from Fremantle to Geraldton.

mri:credit.gco:CharacterString: Integrated Marine Observing System (IMOS). IMOS is a national collaborative research infrastructure, supported by Australian Government.

cit:description.gco:CharacterString: Website of the Australian Ocean Data Network (AODN)

gex:description.gco:CharacterString: Data are available on a geographic grid within the area that corresponds to the union of the regions of coverage of the two relevant radar stations. This is an irregular polygon within which is located a geographic grid with a nominal grid spacing of 6 Km.

mco:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: The citation in a list of references is: "IMOS [year-of-data-download], [Title], [data-access-URL], accessed [date-of-access]." Any users of IMOS data are required to clearly acknowledge the source of the material derived from IMOS in the format: "Data was sourced from the Integrated Marine Observing System (IMOS) - IMOS is a national collaborative research infrastructure, supported by the Australian Government." If relevant, also credit other organisations involved in collection of this particular datastream (as listed in 'credit' in the metadata record).

cit:description.gco:CharacterString: Coral Coast page on IMOS website

mrl:statement.gco:CharacterString: Waverider buoy data from the World Meteorological Organization (WMO) Global Telecommunication System (GTS) is provided, as delivered, by the Bureau of Meteorology. In March 2018, Queensland buoys were added. This data is collated by AODN, and made available as a timeseries. The location of the buoy in the WMO message is recorded in degrees, minutes (not seconds), hence the location is only accurate to 1-2 kilometres.

mcc:dataset.gco:CharacterString: These data were obtained using a range of temperature sensors. Some of the instruments also record pressure, conductivity and other parameters. The raw data were processed to produce a single netCDF file per instrument. The processing includes: * Pre-processing tasks like local time to UTC time conversion; * Calculation of a depth parameter based on pressure values (recorded by the instrument itself, or the nearest two pressure sensors on the mooring) using the Gibbs-SeaWater toolbox (TEOS-10). * Automatic quality control (QC) procedures, checking for impossible date or location, measurements taken out of water, outliers, spikes and flatlines (suspect data are flagged but never removed); * A visual check of the data and QC flags by the operator; * Writing the data and QC flags to an IMOS compliant NetCDF files containing QC'd data sets. For more details see the metadata attached to each data set.

mrl:description.gco:CharacterString: Data inputs to this AODN product include the Bureau of Meteorology near real-time wave buoy data, described in their metadata record [see: http://www.bom.gov.au/metadata/19115/ANZCW0503900478 ].

cit:title.gco:CharacterString: Wave Buoy Observations, Near Real-Time, Australia
